history.text: Hey there, how'd you like Toy Story?
Toy Story was a cute movie.  It is a great lesson for kids to learn, how to be loyal to friends.
It really was a cute movie.  I didn't know that Joss Whedon was involved in the screenplay, did you?
No I never really paid attention to the credits.  I think Tom Hanks and  Tim Allen always were forefront, and noticed more.
That's true, but there were so many other voice actors there too!  I think that's why I really liked it, due to the ensemble cast.  Who will ever forget Don Rickles as Mr. Potato Head?
I always liked Slinky, but as in so many cases, the better know get the credit, and the ones that have stellar performances,, get overlooked.
And who can forget the look at Buzz's face when he realized he was actually a toy?  Kind of a heart-breaking moment, I think.
Woody when he realized he had been forgetten...
Very true.  Did you think about your own childhood toys, when you were watching the movie?
Unlike the boy in the movie I still have some of my original toys put up for my kids.
That's great.  I'm sure they'll enjoy sharing those memories with you someday.  Do you watch a lot of Pixar or other animated films?
Not really, its hard to believe that Toy Story was from 1995, it doesnt seem like it was that long ago
It really was.  In fact, it was Pixar's first animated full-length feature film.
Pixar, in my opinion, was such a step up from regular animation.
It really raised the bar with the current edge techniques and use of computer animation.
I liked all the pranks and antics of the toys, it gave them real personality
Speaking of antics, do you remember the scene when Andy and his family are heading to Pizza Planet and his mother will only let him bring one toy?
Yes, its so hard to choose amongst your friends.  But watching Buzz and Woody go from enemies to friends,, is such a great evolution to watch.  Its also a great lesson for kids, and grown ups
True, true.  And of course the Pizza Planet scene lead to the unforgettable introduction of the "Crane".
Nice, it has some of the best voiced animation of all movies
It really does.  It made me a fan of Tim Allen actually.  I think he was perfectly cast as Buzz Lightyear.
Tom Hanks can read a phone book and make it work, but he had great moments in this movie
Agreed.  And speaking of great moments, how about Andy's new Christmas puppy at the end of the movie?
I would be worried too, between being chewed on, and being ignored, tough situation
Definitely.  Nothing like having a shared enemy to really seal a friendship, eh?
Ha, true.  I had forgotten about the dog Scud, what a great bad guy!
So many great scenes in that movie!
Yes, what a great correlation between actors and characters.
They really brought the characters to life, that's for sure.
Made it a classic for future movies, to measure against.
Agreed.  And really established Pixar as a world-class producer of animated films!
It should habve been a 10 out of 10
Well, Rotten Tomatoes did give it a 100% and viewers gave it an average of 9/10.
Those are really high ratings.  Pretty much a universally loved film.
Rotten Tomatoes does have a great reputation for reviews
And Metacritic scored it a 95 out of 100!
it does have great ratings

uid1response.feedback: It was challenging to establish a rapport with the other user.  Seemed like two people stating their own opinions rather than having a dialog with someone.
